reviewText: Movies starring black actors were few and far between in the 50's and 60's so it was always a treat to see colored people on the big screen in non-stereotypical roles. This movie was originally released as MARK OF THE HAWK in 1958.  "Shaka-Lulu" tells a decent story of native unrest in "pre-independent/colonial"  Africa.  Poitier is superb as usual while Eartha is "muy interesante"! This Classic Black movie belongs in every African-American film library.

This movie has already been released under another name THE MARK OF THE HAWK. How this company can get away with selling that movie under a different title is beyond me. If you already have the MARK OF THE HAWK , you don't need this one.
